About Virat Kohli

Virat Kohli is one of the greatest batsmen in the history of cricket. Known for his aggressive mindset, unmatched consistency, and elite fitness levels, he has redefined modern-day batting across formats.

Early Life

Born on 5 November 1988 in Delhi, Virat Kohli showed early promise in cricket. He trained at the West Delhi Cricket Academy and led India to victory in the 2008 ICC Under-19 World Cup.

International Career

Virat made his ODI debut in 2008 and soon became India’s backbone. As captain, he transformed India into a dominant Test side and led with intensity and passion.

  • Former Captain – India (Tests, ODIs, T20Is)
  • Plays for Royal Challengers Bangalore (IPL)
  • Known for chases and match-winning knocks

Achievements & Records

  • Fastest to 8,000 – 13,000 ODI runs
  • Most centuries while chasing in ODIs
  • Multiple ICC Player of the Year awards
  • Padma Shri & Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna Award
